messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 65 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: PULSE: Optical Circuit Switched Data Center Architecture Operating at Nanosecond Timescales

Paper Abstract: Abstract We introduce PULSE, a sub-Œºùúá\mus optical circuit switched data centre network architecture controlled by distributed hardware schedulers. PULSE is a flat architecture that uses parallel passive coupler-based broadcast and select networks. We employ a novel transceiver architecture, for dynamic wavelength-timeslot selection, to achieve a reconfiguration time down to O(100ps), establishing timeslots of O(10ns). A novel scheduling algorithm that has a clock period of 2.3ns performs multiple iterations to maximize throughput, wavelength usage and reduce latency, enhancing the overall performance. In order to scale, the single-hop PULSE architecture uses sub-networks that are disjoint by using multiple transceivers for each node in 64 node racks. At the reconfiguration circuit duration (epoch = 120 ns), the scheduling algorithm is shown to achieve up to 93% throughput and 100% wavelength usage of 64 wavelengths, incurring an average latency that ranges from 0.7-1.2 Œºùúá\mus with best-case 0.4 Œºùúá\mus median and 5 Œºùúá\mus tail latency, limited by the timeslot (20 ns) and epoch size (120 ns). We show how the 4096-node PULSE architecture allows up to 260k optical channels to be re-used across sub-networks achieving a capacity of 25.6 Pbps with an energy consumption of 82 pJ/bit when using coherent receiver.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 65 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 65"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/service-provider/visual-networking-index-vni/white-paper-c11-741490",
        "VNI: Forecast and Trends, 2017-2022",
        "Jupiter Rising: A Decade of Clos Topologies and Centralized Control in Google‚Äôs Datacenter Network",
        "Intel: World Will Switch to ‚ÄúScale‚Äù Data Centers by 2025",
        "Global warming: Data centres to consume three times as much energy in next decade, experts warn",
        "Allocating Data Center Energy Costs and Carbon to IT Users",
        "95% of Data Centre Traffic will come from Cloud by 2021",
        "Sub-Nanosecond Clock and Data Recovery in an Optically-Switched Data Centre Network",
        "Bobtail - Avoiding Long Tails in the Cloud",
        "Roadmap of optical communications",
        "Petastar: a petabit photonic packet switch",
        "Analysis of wavelength-routed optical burst-switched network performance",
        "Scaling low-latency optical packet switches to a thousand ports",
        "Griffin: Programmable Optical DataCenter With SDN Enabled Function Planning and Virtualisation",
        "POTORI: a passive optical ToR interconnect architecture for Data Centers",
        "Scalable Optical Interconnect Architecture Using AWGR-Based TONAK LION Switch With Limited Number of Wavelengths",
        "IRIS optical packet router",
        "A Scalable, Partially Configurable Optical Switch for Data Center Networks",
        "High-Port and Low-Latency Optical Switches for Disaggregated Data Centers: The HipoŒªùúÜ\\lambdaaos Switch Architecture",
        "Opsquare: A flat dcn architecture based on flow-controlled optical packet switches",
        "A High-Radix, Low-Latency Optical Switch for Data Centers",
        "Hybrid Wavelength Switched-TDMA High Port Count All-Optical DC Switch",
        "A High Speed Hardware Scheduler for 1000-Port OPSs to Enable Scalable Data Centers",
        "A Decade of Accelerated Computing Augurs Well For GPUs",
        "Seeking Big A.I. Advances, a Startup Turns to a Huge Computer Chip",
        "Evolution of the GPU Device widely used in AI and Massive Parallel Processing",
        "DARPA FastNICs Program Looks to Accelerate Application Performance by 100x",
        "Stardust: Divide and Conquer in the DCN",
        "Inside the Social Network‚Äôs (Datacenter) Network",
        "High port count hybrid wavelength switched TDMA optical switch for Data Centers",
        "Optical burst switching: research and applications",
        "Hundred-Picoseconds Electro-Optical Switching With Semiconductor Optical Amplifiers Using Multi-Impulse Step Injection Current",
        "AN-2095 Controlling the S7500 CW Tunable Laser-RevA Updated",
        "Less than 5-ns wavelength switching with an SG-DBR laser",
        "Energy Efficiency of VCSELs in the Context of Short-Range Optical Links",
        "Photonic-chip-based frequency combs",
        "A broad-band MQW semiconductor optical amplifier with high saturation output power and low noise figure",
        "A 3-Vppd 730-mW Linear Driver IC Using InP HBTs for Advanced Optical Modulations",
        "Wavelength Division Multiplexing: A Practical Engineering Guide",
        "Roadmap on all-optical processing",
        "Compact and high-sensitivity 100-Gb/s (4√ó\\times 25 Gb/s) APD-ROSA with a LAN-WDM PLC demultiplexer",
        "Optically Disaggregated Data Centers with minimal remote memory latency: Technologies, architectures, and resource allocation [Invited]",
        "Photonic ASIC directly integrates 100G optical ports",
        "TeraPHY: A High-Density Electronic-Photonic Chiplet for Optical I/O from a Multi-Chip Module",
        "Ayar Labs to Demo Photonics Chiplet in FPGA Package at Hot Chips",
        "100GBASE-LR4 10 km Gen2 QSFP28 Optical Transceiver",
        "Platforms for Integrated Photonic Switching Modules",
        "Sub-nanosecond optical switching using chip-based soliton microcombs",
        "High Speed Ethernet Optics Report",
        "Arista Networks 7260CX3-64 Layer 3 Switch",
        "Arista Networks 7170-64C Layer 3 Switch",
        "Optimization of multiple PON deployment costs and comparison between GPON, XGPON, NGPON2 and UDWDM PON",
        "Generic Compatible 100GBASE-SR4 QSFP28 850nm 100m DOM Transceiver Module",
        "Public executive summary of the final Project Periodic Report",
        "Digital Coherent Transmission for Next Generation Cable Operators‚Äô Optical Access Networks",
        "800G: Coherent versus PAM4 Optical Transceivers Inside Data Centers",
        "HELIOS: A Hybrid Electrical/Optical Switch Architecture for Modular DCNs",
        "OSA: An Optical Switching Architecture for Data Center Networks With Unprecedented Flexibility",
        "RotorNet: A Scalable, Low-complexity, Optical Datacenter Network",
        "FireFly: A Reconfigurable Wireless Data Center Fabric Using Free-space Optics",
        "Circuit Switching Under the Radar with REACToR",
        "A Multiport Microsecond Optical Circuit Switch for Data Center Networking",
        "A petabit photonic packet switch (p3s)",
        "DOS - A Scalable Optical Switch for Data Centers",
        "Optical clock distribution using a mode-locked semiconductor laser diode system"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 65 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in PULSE: Optical Circuit Switched Data Center Architecture Operating at Nanosecond Timescales, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
